column4: ValueError: /usr/bin/python does not match the python default version. It must be reset to point to python2.6
Where is the File that gives the value of the default Python to ubuntu on karmic?
It is just a symlink to the real python.
So how do i fix this
I don't know the problem.  fix what?
There is a lot of traffic in this channel.  I don't know your root problem and so I answered what I saw you ask.
What do you get from      ls -l /usr/bin/python
how is the command to link it against python2.6
Is this computer running Karmic or Lucid.  Your symlink points to Python 2.5.  Even Jaunty used Python 2.6
reinstalling python may be a good idea.  What I'd worry about is what else is messed up.  Did your upgrade have visible problems?
i now uninstall python like slimjimflim said
That is scary.  You are probably removing things you need.
Mark Shuttleworth is a python programmer.  Python is used for lots of things on Ubuntu and is a dependancy.  My guess is you will end up reinstalling, if you really did the uninstall.
